macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Sell-Off Led by Tech Stocks and Bitcoin Plunge
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 1.2% to 6,798.40, Dow dropped 1.2% to 48,908.72, and Nasdaq sank 1.6% to 22,540.59 amid tech declines, Bitcoin's 8% drop, and weak US jobs data. Investors rotated to bonds, pushing 10-year Treasury yield down to 4.19%.[1][4][5][6]
items.source: Multiple Sources including AP and TipRanks

items.title: Gold and Silver Prices Tumble in Risk-Off Environment
items.summary: Gold touched $4,655/oz before rebounding, while silver dropped 9.1% to around $64/oz lows. Commodities broadly fell as risk appetite waned, with Bitcoin down 30% monthly.[1][4]

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed After US Tech Sell-Off
items.summary: Nikkei 225 rose 0.81% to 54,254 led by tech gains, but Hang Seng fell 1.21% to 26,560, Shanghai Composite down 0.25% to 4,066, and Australia's ASX 200 shed 2% to 8,708.80.[1][5]

items.title: RBA Delivers Hawkish Rate Hike Amid Inflation Concerns
items.summary: Australia's central bank hiked rates with hawkish messaging and higher-for-longer inflation forecasts, dragging Australian shares down 1.8% weekly.[2]

items.title: McKesson Surges on Strong Earnings Beat
items.summary: McKesson jumped 16.5% after reporting stronger-than-expected quarterly profit and revenue, and raising its full-year profit forecast.[4]
items.source: AP via Iron Mountain Daily News

items.title: Toyota CEO to Step Down in Leadership Change
items.summary: Toyota Motor shares rose 2% as CEO Koji Sato announced he will step down in April, replaced by CFO Kenta Kon.[5]

items.title: US Bond Yields Fall on Labor Market Anxiety and Fed Uncertainty
items.summary: 10-year US Treasury yield dropped to 4.20% (down 1.6 bp overnight) amid leverage unwinding, AI capex concerns, weak jobs data, and Fed policy doubts.[1][4]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Plunges Below $70,000 to Lowest Since Trump's Win
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped to a low of $66,675 on Thursday, its lowest since October 2024, amid reduced risk appetite, tech stock selloffs, and concerns over Trump's Fed chair pick Kevin Warsh potentially adopting a hawkish stance. The global crypto market lost $800 billion in the past month, with Bitcoin down 6.5% to $67,817 and Ether falling over 7% to $1,973.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Systems Demonstrate Bounded Self-Governance Within Safety Limits
items.summary: Researchers showcased AI systems capable of recursive self-modification of coordination protocols while preserving strict safety invariants, achieving a 50% increase in proposal coverage. The study highlights technical feasibility for auditable, governed AI adaptations using current models.

items.title: Chinese Researchers Achieve Breakthrough in Long-Distance Quantum Communication
items.summary: A team generated device-independent quantum encryption keys over 11 km of optical fiber, extending prior records by 3,000 times, and validated scalability up to 100 km. They also developed long-lived quantum memory for practical quantum repeaters.

items.title: Yoshua Bengio Nominated to UN's New AI Advisory Panel
items.summary: Canadian AI pioneer Yoshua Bengio is among 40 independent experts proposed for the UN's first global AI panel, aimed at assessing AI impacts like the IPCC does for climate change. The panel, independent of governments and companies, will release its first report in July.

items.title: USA Corporate AI and Data Science Education Market Valued at $15 Billion
items.summary: The market, driven by demand for 2.3 million AI jobs and rapid tech advancements, is led by San Francisco, New York, and Boston. Growth reflects corporate needs for training in machine learning and data analytics amid digital transformation.

items.title: Critique: AI-Human Intelligence Comparisons Overlook Collective Human Strengths
items.summary: Associate Professor Celeste Rodriguez Louro argues that claims of superintelligent AI ignore human intelligence's collective, embodied, and cultural nature, warning of data scarcity and echo chambers from AI-generated training data.
items.source: University of Western Australia / The Conversation

items.title: CybPass Advances AI Assurance for Autonomous Systems like Drones and Self-Driving Cars
items.summary: CybPass CEO discusses next-gen AI assurance tools to ensure safety and security in autonomous systems including robotics and vehicles.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Reveals Switch 2 Games and Demos
items.summary: The February 5th Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase announced upcoming titles for Nintendo Switch and Switch 2, including Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection, PRAGMATA demos, Kyoto Xanadu, Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse, and Resident Evil Requiem.

items.title: Blizzard QA Workers Ratify Union Contract with Microsoft
items.summary: Quality assurance workers at Blizzard have successfully ratified a union contract with Microsoft, marking a significant labor agreement in the gaming industry.

items.title: Ghost of Yotei Outperforms Ghost of Tsushima
items.summary: Sony's Ghost of Yotei has exceeded the performance of its predecessor Ghost of Tsushima, contributing positively to Sony's financial results.

items.title: Ubisoft Union Representatives Call for CEO Yves Guillemot's Resignation
items.summary: Union representatives at Ubisoft have called for the resignation of CEO Yves Guillemot amid ongoing industry tensions.

items.title: Major Game Releases: Dragon Quest 7 Reimagined and Nioh 3
items.summary: Highly-anticipated titles Dragon Quest 7 Reimagined and Nioh 3 released this week, alongside Cairn, MY HERO ACADEMIA: All's Justice, and PUBG: Blindspot.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Announces $200 Billion Capex Increase for 2026
items.summary: Amazon plans to boost capital spending by more than 50% to $200 billion in 2026, focusing on data centers and infrastructure, leading to an 11% drop in after-hours shares amid investor concerns over profitability.

items.title: Tech Stocks Plunge on Wall Street Amid Investment Fears
items.summary: Major tech firms like Amazon, Microsoft, Nvidia, Tesla, and Meta saw significant share declines following announcements of massive capital expenditures, with the Nasdaq dropping 1.6% and broader market worries about liquidity.

items.title: PayPal Appoints HP CEO Enrique Lores as New Leader
items.summary: PayPal has named Enrique Lores, former CEO of HP, as its new CEO, marking a key leadership change in the fintech sector.

items.title: Santander Acquires Webster Bank for $12.2 Billion
items.summary: Santander bolsters its US presence through a $12.2 billion acquisition of Webster Bank, expanding its banking operations.

items.title: Toyota CEO Koji Sato to Step Down in April
items.summary: Toyota Motor announced that CEO Koji Sato will step down in April, replaced by CFO Kenta Kon, amid mixed market reactions.

items.title: Nubank Gains OCC Approval for US Launch
items.summary: Brazilian digital bank Nubank advances its US expansion after receiving OCC approval, positioning for growth in the American market.

items.title: Varo Bank Raises $123.9 Million in Series G Funding
items.summary: US challenger bank Varo Bank secures $123.9 million in Series G funding to support its growth initiatives.
